text: Eckhard Heinrich Hess (27 September 1916 – 21 February 1986) was a German-born American psychologist and ethologist, known for his research on pupillometry and animal imprinting. He joined the Department of Psychology at the University of Chicago as an instructor in 1948. He became a full professor in the Department of Psychology in 1959, and served as its chairman from 1963 to 1968. ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:1916 births Category:1986 deaths Category:People from Bochum Category:Johns Hopkins University alumni Category:University of Chicago faculty Category:German emigrants to the United States Category:American psychologists Category:Ethologists Category:20th- century psychologists Category:20th-century zoologists
